intro: Pavia fulva, commonly known as the yellow pavia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The botanical features of Pavia fulva make it a notable species in the Rubiaceae family.
